comment: Nose is sweet and slightly flowery, cherry blossomish, the port maturation is immediately and unapologetically evident. Initial tastes are sweet and syrupy. Thick silky mouth feel. Candied oranges and dark chocolate. Maybe slightly nutty. Finish is very long and introduces hints of pepper and spices like cinnamon and nutmeg.
Similar to the 12 with more chocolate
Big improvement over the former 12yr version. Definitely worth getting yourself a bottle or two!
Fudge, butter cake, ananas, coconut, nutmeg, chocolate, nutty.
It’s a bit harsher of a taste than I would typically prefer
Love love love this. Loved the 10/12, now this 14 is just like the previous versions on steroids. Delicious velvety goodness.

I actually like the 12 year slightly more. This one is a bit thinner and not as dark, surprisingly. Still velvety, still rich, still oily, still fantastic, but not quite as much as the 12 year. A bit more spice and chocolate than it’s younger counterpart.
"Damn that's smooth" was my first thought. Amazing, mild and flavorful at the same time, woody, with some berry notes. You get the strength in the swallow, with a hint of peat.
Delectable dram with notes of mint chocolate, citrus, orange, vanilla, berry cobbler, peach, strawberry jam, and barley spices. Don’t know for sure but probably a bit above the old 12.

This is one of my all time favorites.  The nose is incredible.  It is a little sweeter than some, but with just a hint of smoke to balance it out.  I do tend to lean toward bourbon barrel aged whisky, and this one delivers, with the extra four years in port casks giving it an added depth of character.  I was a fan of the 12 year expression and this is a slight improvement over an already excellent dram.

Picked this up a couple of weeks ago and have spent some time with it. It has a beautiful and unique rose color - hopefully this is natural color. Lots of plum and grapes on the nose and palate augmenting that familiar base Glenmorangie honey malt. I notice that with water there is a bit of bitter bite on the end, but a couple drops of water remove it. With a bit of water added it is dangerously drinkable. Very good.

A solid highland scotch with interesting chocolate notes.

Nose: sweet raisins
Palate: Sweet, smooth, molasses, raisins, and a hint of chocolate
Finish: Super sugary finish medium to long in length.

Nose has raisins, caramel, and toasted marshmallows.

Taste is a great balance of brine, sweet, spice, and warming heat leading to a lingering finish.

Bought as a box of four bottles (10 cl each) for $30.
Vanilla on the nose. Floral, dark fruits. Rich and full flavored. Chocolate on the palate. Chocolate and maybe smooth nuttiness on the palate and finish. Smooth and rich.
Sweet, with hints of spice, mint chocolate, and a delightful sherry overtone. Great for desert or a great introduction to finished whisky.
Enjoyed the old 12 year version more.

Reddish color, viscous, clear, likely chill-filtered. Nose is moderate, with hints of rose, raisins, vanilla and a bit of tobacco. Palate is smooth and rich, sweet, with hints of chocolate, vanilla, oak, sherry, and a bit of lemon zest. Finish is medium-length, with a touch of bitterness and floral in character. A touch of water in this 46% ABV dram opens additional sweetness and fruitiness. Aftertaste gains more citrus notes and becomes longer. Water definitely makes this one more round and well-balanced. Overall, it’s a pleasant dram, reasonably rich yet not too difficult, with a definitive port influence. Part of a 3-bottle collection bought at Costco for $99. Definitely worth the money.

Nose: Ripe Cherry, strawberry, herbal
Palate: Initial heat, creamy mouthfeel, cherry tart, almond, herbs
Finish: Lingering sweetness with some heat
Lots of Burn, not much beyond that. Disappointed, to say the least

So much fruit all the way through! The distiller description is spot on, strawberries on the nose with a hint of vanilla. Taste is very sweet, with very obvious port influence. Wont be an everyday whiskey for me, but an Excellent desert dram, kind of in line with mwnd.

Pours a bit of a pink color, or at least it's a pink hue within the traditional golden color here.  Legs are there..it's 46%, nothing special.  

On the nose i get toasted wood, a bit of jam, some light spiced bread.  There's nothing intense or interesting here at all.  A lot of muted spice and tannin from both likely bourbon barrels and perhaps some port.  

The flavor is a bit more interesting.  It had a nice body that they call velvety and I'll agree with them.  It has rich sweetness and I can get a touch of mint and orange as they note on the box.  There is a good amount of rather mellow and yet spiced oak in here, I don't recall this much oak from the 12 year.  I also don't recall this much mouth feel.  

Finish is medium, it doesn't last forever and it becomes a touch spicy and dry.  

A good 45 dollar bottle, but nothing special and all and all uneventful.

So my screen name is from college, I studied biomedical science and Austin Powers had just come out; my reference was from the part where Dr. Evil was asking Scott about his future plans like running a petting zoo.. "an Evil petting zoo?" Dr. Evil exclaimed.  I added it to my email - and it never went away. Back to booze: I grabbed this bottle because everything i’v had from Glenmorangie has been pretty darn good - and ...this whiskey happens to follow suit- the mouth feel during the finish is exceptional - its velvety and delicious. My only complaint is the nose - it's a little jumbled, its fruity and funky - specifically; it has a dried apricot note which I never equate to quality - I have a bunch of ice wines and the bogus tasting note for lower end bottles is apricot - So Im' unequivocally bias; considering some people may enjoy that element. Anywhoooo... this is good stuff and definitely great VFM. Cheers
Similar to sherry cask 12 yr. sweet. Less spicy. Gasoline after taste?
Very excellent. Didn’t have the time to do a good profile but truly exceptional

Glenmorangie changed up the age statement on the Quinta Ruban from 12 years to 14 years.  so naturally I had to buy both and compare.  The 12 year old was finished for 2 years in port barrels.  So we all assume that the 14 year meant 4 years of finishing in port.  Well after comparing the two I think it still is only 2 years of finishing in port.  

The color is a hint lighter than the 12 year.  It seams to have lost a little bit of that redness that the 12 year had.  The smell is lighter and the taste is lighter as well.  As for the finish....well yep you guessed it.  Now the finish is probably the closest similarity to the 12 year old which is a good thing.  It really is only a hint lighter.  

So in conclusion the new 14 year old is still very good and still is full of flavors.  I will be buying it again but I will also be buying up all the remaining 12 year olds as well.
Definite port nose, somewhat dull. Taste mezcal finish that lingers.
Clean crisp hint of sweetness at finish
Lots of leather, fruit, very smooth. Drinks very easily. Love this dram
Very similar to the sherry cask but less peat.
Very light Spivey port taste. Ok finish
Delicious, port and dried fruit. Cream and dark chocolate. Peppery finish that lasts.

Nose- diluted cough syrup 
Color- rose
Taste- lack of complexity for 14 yrs. Reminds me of why I never liked cough syrup because of its taste - not body. Assertive ethanol notes. Not rich. Not very pleasant. Disappointed.

★★★★½
C'est exactement dans ma palette!
Voici une soirée de tempête hivernal qui ne pouvais mieux commencer. Bon on a dû attendre 30 minutes avant que les portes n'ouvrent, mais on nous prenait pour des gens de l'industrie et on nous a offert ce succulent whisky tout simplement gratuitement. Je vais aller m'en acheter quelques bouteilles dès que je peux, vous devriez faire la même chose!
Velvety smooth beautiful color and smell
Very smooth. Fruity.  Get more wood on the nose then the taste.  Excellent Dram.
Not so Smokey. Hints of orange, dried apple and dark chocolate. A fine dram!

Nose: starts salty with grape background, continues to peated tones and finishes with sweeter vanilla tones.
Body: full and rich, salty-sweet tones
Finish: spices and bitterness

Mild sweet aroma that I can't place. It's wonderful though. Flavor is also mild, mostly that sweetness. Light and approachable, light body and not much of a tail. Sweetness is maybe just sugar, like simple syrup.

A: Light Sap
N: Vanilla, Hints of citrus, light fruits
P: Buttered popcorn, spice, slightly fruity
F: Medium, some lingering spice
Sweet with bit of lingering flavor, would buy again
Cherry hiding in a smooth scotch.
Dark colored beauty. Strong spicy, vanilla, briny (?) and caramel flavors.

Smells like Venice or Trasverre in Rome, fresh water but not salty
palate is very short and warm, floral and nutty

Spicy, dark chocolat on the nose, you clearly tast that is a port finish. 
Rich and tasty in the mouth, orange zest, Vanilla
With a good finish, I like it with a little drop of water.

Take it on a sunday night with a Miles Davis

Slàinte !
Nose is pretty bland for a port finished 14 yr whiskey but flavour is lingering port fruit flavours and whisps of smoke
Very smooth with a nice pepper finish
Dark chocolate and spice throughout. Hints of orange peel and I get a tiny bit of berries. Lingers on the palate for quite a while.
Nice and smooth scotch. Full, sweet and rich. Opens up on the rocks
Very smooth and great aroma. Port cask finish adds fantastic qualities.

#퀸타루반 - 젠틀한 노신사
향 : 우디
맛 : 우디, 나무나무, 씁쓸
피니쉬 : 알콜, 생나무, 씁쓸피니쉬

노즈: 포트와인의 눅진한 향과 딸기의 상큼한 향 그 중간 어디쯤, 가까이가면 볶은 아몬드 향, 바닐라 아이스크림
팔레트: 잘 익은 적포도의 달콤, 상큼함이 지나고 스파이시함, 침과 섞이면 더 달아짐
피니쉬:  약간의 도수감, 견과류 고소함, 몰트의 단맛이 아우러짐

Color: Amber (hints of Pink)/Maple Brown, a few long legs on the twirl - slightly oily

Nose: Candied Raisins, Sweet Nuts, Brown Sugar, Orange Citrus

Taste: Flavor burst of sweet Raisins, A massive dose of Chestnuts follow, Chinese Plums, Toffee

Finish: Sweetness lingers for an initial smooth and quick finish, a slight earthy (grass?) and Nutty taste lingers longer

Overall: Beautiful dessert dram, I feel like I’m drinking a Port. I can see this substituting for a fruit jam with a cheese plate.

(4/29/20)

Glenmorangie Quinta Ruban 12 & 14 year versions

QR 12, 46% non chillfiltered
Nose: sweet dried fruit, sticky prunes, spice, honey 
Taste: sweet, fruity, honey, baking spice-turns dry, then more honey

Glenmorangie Quinta Ruban 14, 46%, non chillfiltered
Nose: citrus, orange peel-spiciness, more orange, a Terri’s chocolate orange
Taste: rich, dark fruits, juicy, then turns dry, chocolate, bitter chocolate, mint, spices.  Wow!

With a little water and time you’ll get vanilla cake.  Like an orange vanilla cake with chocolate filling 🤤 -

Both versions are great.  On the nose the 12 is more fruity sweet, where the 14 is more orange citrus spicy-sweet.  Taste is similar, but the 14 goes more dark chocolate, spicy, more complex than the 12 year.  Good on Glenmorangie for adding on 2 years at the same price  and making a fantastic whisky. .
.
.
Lovely cereal notes on the nose are complimented by a complex and bold fruity finish. My favorite of their cask finishes.
Has the color of a bourbon.  Dark fruit in the nose.  Brine is present immediately but finishes hot.

Candy-sweet journey with a candy-sweet finish. If I try to pick out taste notes from the port finish: raisins, figs, prunes, and red fruits come to mind.  The 46% ABV lends intensity to the sweetness.  And, I find it holds up well against the other sherry-cask expressions in my collection: the Dalmore 12, Glendronach 12 & 15, Bunnahabhain 12, and Glenfiddich 15.



My Rating Glossary:  

Two Stars:           "I'd rather be drinking lite beer."
Two 1/2 Stars:    "Posh rubbish."
Three Stars:        "I love whisk(e)y.  This is average love."
Three 1/2 Stars: "May buy again."
Four Stars:          "I've got to get you into my life."
Four 1/2 Stars:   "Better than drugs."
Five Stars:           "Life is good.  Whisky makes it better."
Interesting highland. Not too smokey or peaty. Great finish.
Port wine sweetness that lingers. The port is dominant on nose to me as well. Smooth and fruity. Really enjoy this one. Makes a great after dinner pour.

Classic bourbon barrel undertones of a basic vanilla-heavy sweet oak. But as is typical glenmorangie, the finishing is in the foreground. The port sings here with a raisin-dominated sweetness that has impressive oakiness but throughout all layers is a wheat bread note from the malt. All flavors come through, all are layered, all are strong.

Nose: mild floral sweetness, lingering port wine, boozy smell right after pouring, bourbon notes on front end, red velvet cake 
Taste: rich, full, round, dessert like flavor, not as sweet as I expected based on nose, malty, drier rosé wine, round mature fruit, adding water releases very decadent oak and fruit with slight velvety dessert flavor
Beautiful color, fruity and sweet from the cask finish. Hints of dark chocolate flavor

Deep. Deep like a Scottish loch. The label mentions chocolate, yes, it’s there. I think it’s more  richer than fruity.its warm all the way down. I like it. Also the aroma you really do get a whiff of pure aged wood.
Refreshing add to a smooth single malt

Nose: Apricot, iodine, cigar smoke and jolly rancher. The mouth feel is just a little oily, like a slightly melted Hershey kiss (though don't get me wrong,there's only the bare hint of dark chocolate in the taste). 
The taste is lovely, and distinct: Caramel, cherry, port, and a rapid snap of heat, both to the top of the mouth and the back of the throat. It is never too sweet; rather, it's rich and rewarding, and a rare mixture of sweet and heat. Imagine a very adult sourpatch kid, fermented in a barrel of perfectly dried apricot. Honestly, this is a first rate spirit, as long as you don't need that snap, that reminder that you're drinking whiskey...and that may be the only negative here (and this makes this comparable, say, with the somewhat similar Angel's Envy Port Finished Rye):  this may be too easy to drink, too much of a pleasure.
Dark fruit nose, copper color, hint of orange nose, alcoholic smell, heat without water, with a few drops of water: chocolate, orange, deep/full
1st Club taste - Sweet, rich, strawberry notes, excellent finish. Prettiest color in a scotch I’ve seen - Dark, deep amber with a hint of pink.🏆

Club Taste : H. Ashton 
Beautiful color matches a beautiful taste. A nose full of berries, a palate full of toasted cereal, nuts, and spice. Caramel  coats the throat.  Sweet done right.
Fruity and a little citrusy, incredibly smooth.  A contender with Balvenie 14 year Caribbean cask.

Dried fruit on the nose. Tannic bite (if that makes sense for a scotch). Medium body, but a bit chewy. Lots of port from start to finish. Bit of almond. Peated like a real scotch (guess it is). Slightly sour on the finish. Good, but not worth the price.
Sweet and carmel like. Very easy to drink, probably a good starter for new scotch drinkers.

Since I was a huge fan of the previous, 12 y.o. version of Quinta Ruban (and still am though it's pushing from hard to impossible to get a bottle), I was expecting a similar if not a greater approach on this Glenmorangie style of finishing whiskies in casks that previously contained different sorts of spirits, and in this case particularly, in ex-ruby casks, what constantly provides a distinctive tone both in aroma and taste. Although I would prefer to steer clear of the term "disappointed", I feel kinda fooled this time.

A bit plainer in overall, bit harsher, bit poorer in balance, somehow lacking this "port" flavor, which was really the point, yet still it is a remarkable (or close to that) whisky to consume, and at least I appreciate the distillery's versatility in a sense of trying to develop things that worked perfectly good in prior, even if it's not quite the successful case.

To the nose: sweet, full yet not really directed, a bit spirituous - caramel, tight and ropy sugar syrup, molasses, avocado with olive oil, warm chocolate covered cherries, mint, cocoa and coffee beans.

To the palate: not very pronounced nor smooth, sometimes bold, with sweet herbal tones (like clover), sugary cough syrup, pineapple, plums, definite citruses, buckwheat honey, honey with rose petals, cayenne pepper, peppermint bubblegum.

In the aftertaste: bitter wood, conifer, tree gum, tangerines, hot spices, sweet mustard, a bit of chocolate.

Is this whisky bad? Not at all. It is decent but it could have been much more than just that.

Glenmorangie 14YO QUINTA RUBAN 46%
Spicy berry notes 2
Berry, less oily, sweetness 2.75
Spicy finish - lingering berry 2.5
